intro: Chayamaritia vietnamensis, commonly known as Vietnamese chayamaritia, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
